title: The Village Voice
summary: The Village Voice is an American news and culture paper, known for being the country's first alternative newsweekly.[3] Founded in 1955 by Dan Wolf, Ed Fancher, John Wilcock, and Norman Mailer, the Voice began as a platform for the creative community of New York City. It ceased publication in 2017, while its online archives remained accessible.  After an ownership change, the Voice reappeared in print, now as a quarterly, in April 2021.[3]
